attributes.action: Revoke Article 50 now, and allow a long cooling-off period
attributes.additional_details: The last three years have shown (starkly) that for the UK to safely to leave the EU would have taken at least a decade of forward planning. To do so now will be enormously damaging and would reduce the UK to a vassal state of the USA. We need to stop the whole thing, rethink the situation, and revisit it once the febrile heat has cooled. There may be a case to go ahead with Brexit, but it has not yet been made, demonstrating the intellectual weakness of this current adventure..
attributes.background: Brexit has torn the country apart, cost around £ 80 BILLION and has damaged families. It was started without a plan and will be hugely damaging for decades to come. If we are to do this thing, we must be sure of the will of the people, and must have a proper plan in place. Time needed for that.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the UK Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do, in particular we're not sure what exactly you mean by "allow a long cooling-off period". 

You could start a new petition asking to Revoke Article 50 and to have another referendum on leaving the EU in 10 years, if that's something you'd like to see happen.
